channel.title: walmo on Walmo SDLC Test
channel.description: Recent content in walmo on Walmo SDLC Test

item.title: HTML Based Pages
item.description: Trying colours You need to do this in html as markdown does not use colours by default. Some Markdown text with Simple blue coloured text. Back to normal text. Now we can highlight in red this is red. Below is the html for the colours Some Markdown text with <span style="color:blue"> Simple <b>blue</b> coloured text.<br> </span>Back to normal text. Now we can highlight in <span style="color:red"> <b>red</b> this is red.

item.title: Flowcharts Notes
item.description: Here is mermaid using shortcodes graph LR; A[Hard edge] --|Link text| B(Round edge) B -- C{Decision} C --|One| D[Result one] C --|Two| E[Result two] graph LR; A[Hard edge] -->|Link text| B(Round edge) B --> C{Decision} C -->|One| D[Result one] C -->|Two| E[Result two] Gantt Diagrams gantt dateFormat YYYY-MM-DD title Adding GANTT diagram functionality to mermaid section A section Completed task :done, des1, 2020-01-06,2020-01-08 Active task :active, des2, 2020-01-09, 3d Future task : des3, after des2, 5d Future task2 : des4, after des3, 5d section Critical tasks Completed task in the critical line :crit, done, 2020-01-06,24h Implement parser and json :crit, done, after des1, 2d Create tests for parser :crit, active, 3d Future task in critical line :crit, 5d Create tests for renderer :2d Add to mermaid :1d Class Diagrams classDiagram Class01 C2 : Where am i?

item.title: Markdown Tables
item.description: Tables You can create tables by assembling a list of words and dividing them with hyphens - (for the first row), and then separating each column with a pipe |: so this First Header | Second Header ------------ | ------------- Content from cell 1 | Content from cell 2 Content in the first column | Content in the second column Renders as this First Header Second Header Content from cell 1 Content from cell 2 Content in the first column Content in the second column shopping list pt 1 allen wrenches gerbil feeders toilet seats electric heaters Trash compactors juice extractor shower rods and water meters shopping list pt 2 Walkie-talkies copper wires safety goggles radial tires shopping list pt 3 BB pellets rubber mallets fans and dehumidifiers shopping list pt 4 Picture hangers paper cutters waffle irons

item.title: Auto-Doc
item.description: Auto-Doc Sample Front Matter Hugo Front Matter is the sites Metadata --- title: "You Title goes here" date: 2020-04-13T17:36:16+01:00 draft: true tags: [ "if required" ] categories: [ "Your category here" ] components: ["Jira aligned component"] authors: ["name of document owner"] --- graph LR; A--B; Then another diagram graph TB c1--a2 subgraph one a1--a2 end subgraph two b1--b2 end subgraph three c1--c2 end graph LR id1(Start)--id2(Stop) style id1 fill:#f00,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px style id2 fill:#0f0,stroke:#f66,stroke-width:2px,color:#fff,stroke-dasharray: 5, 5 graph LR id1((Drawing a circle)) graph TD B["

item.title: TFS Info
item.description: Chapter Basic info Introduction to TFS Based on test notes

item.title: Site Content Info
item.description: Basic help about the site Our basic taxonomy comes from the Metadata in our ‘Front Matter’ This page has the following ‘Front Matter’ taxonomy. tags: ["content" , "help" , "taxonomy"] catagories: ["help"] components: ["hugo"] authors: ["walmo"] Our types of taxonomy we are using are based on our configuration file. The contents [“content” , “help” , “taxonomy”] we add when we create our file. More accurate content in our Metadata will help users navigate the documents contained within the site.

item.title: Team Types
item.description: Test clip from document Aim of the Document This document is an attempt to guide TFS administrators through the process required to create a more complex hierarchical structure under the VM project folder. We will run through an example using the IIB Technical Team to guide you through the process. Initial Considerations Most importantly is that we have had a discussion with the users to understand what it they wish to achieve.
